text: Clyde James Smith (28 January 1901 – 5 January 1935) was a former Australian rules footballer who played with Collingwood in the Victorian Football League (VFL). Smith made one appearance for Collingwood in the 1921 VFL season and six in the 1922 VFL season, then left the club to coach Cobram. A police constable, Smith was accidentally shot and killed by a colleague's firearm while on duty in Frankston on 5 January 1935. == Notes == == External links == * *Clyde Smith's profile at Collingwood Forever Category:1901 births Category:1935 deaths Category:Australian rules footballers from South Australia Category:Collingwood Football Club players Category:Sturt Football Club players Category:Accidental deaths in Victoria (Australia) Category:Australian police officers Category:Police officers killed in the line of duty Category:Deaths by firearm in Victoria (Australia)
title: Clyde Smith (footballer)
